conversation.message:
Hi Company_A—thanks for outlining what you need. Here are the specifics you asked for:

(1) Two end-to-end projects
• Project 1 (8 weeks): Cross-functional launch of a new internal workflow/tooling change.
  - Stakeholders: Ops lead, Eng (2 devs), Support, and a data/analytics partner.
  - My role: Owned the delivery plan (milestones, weekly check-ins, risk log), wrote the rollout comms/training, and coordinated fixes during pilot.
  - Outcome: Shipped on schedule; reduced handoff delays and rework (fewer back-and-forth escalations) and improved cycle time for the workflow.

• Project 2 (6 weeks): Customer-facing process improvement + KPI dashboard.
  - Stakeholders: Product, CS, and Analytics.
  - My role: Defined requirements, aligned on success metrics, managed implementation sequencing, and ran stakeholder reviews.
  - Outcome: Delivered a single source of truth dashboard and a standardized process; improved visibility and faster weekly decision-making.

(2) Strongest execution gap: cross-team coordination (with delivery ownership as a close second). I’m best at keeping multiple functions aligned, surfacing risks early, and driving to decisions so work doesn’t stall.

Given this, is there any realistic path for reconsideration this round (even if the scope is more execution/coordination-heavy than the original role)?
